evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Plaintiffs ... respectfully move pursuant to Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 65 for a preliminary injunction. ... Court should enter an order that enjoins Defendants from implementing their decision in April 2025 to terminate grants issued by the U.S. Department of Justice Office of Justice Programs. Dated: May 22, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a motion for a preliminary injunction on May 22, 2025, seeking to enjoin the Department of Justice Office of Justice Programs from terminating grant funding issued in April 2025.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Dismiss and Memorandum in Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction
Defendants' Motion to Dismiss and Memorandum in Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: For the reasons set forth above, the Court should deny Plaintiffs’ motion for a preliminary injunction, dismiss Plaintiffs’ complaint, and enter judgment in Defendants’ favor.

extracted.value: Defendants filed a motion to dismiss and memorandum in opposition to Plaintiffs' motion for preliminary injunction on June 9, 2025, requesting the court to dismiss Plaintiffs’ complaint and deny the preliminary injunction.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification
Defendants' Opposition to Plaintiffs' Motion for Class Certification
evidence.text: For the foregoing, the Court should deny Plaintiffs’ motion for class certification.

extracted.value: Defendants filed an opposition to Plaintiffs' motion for class certification on June 9, 2025, arguing that the court should deny the motion.

evidence.text: 51 | 2025-07-10 | Emergency MOTION for Injunction Pending Appeal by CENTER FOR CHILDREN & YOUTH JUSTICE, CHINESE FOR AFFIRMATIVE ACTION, FORCE DETROIT, HEALTH RESOURCES IN ACTION

evidence.source_document: Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal
evidence.text: Plaintiffs' 51 Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal by Tuesday, July 15, at 5:00 PM. ... an injunction preventing the re-obligation of the terminated grant funding as to the five Named Plaintiffs, conditioned on their seeking and receiving expedited review in the D.C. Circuit.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an emergency motion for injunction pending appeal on July 10, 2025, seeking an injunction preventing the re-obligation of terminated grant funding and expediting review.

evidence.text: Unopposed MOTION for Leave to File Amicus Brief by LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, AND PROSECUTING ATTORNEYS.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an unopposed motion for leave to file amicus brief on June 6, 2025, by Local Governments, Local Government Officials, and Prosecuting Attorneys.

evidence.text: Unopposed MOTION for Leave to File Amicus Brief by Community-Based Public Safety Subgrantees.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an unopposed motion for leave to file amicus brief on June 6, 2025, by Community-Based Public Safety Subgrantees.

evidence.text: Unopposed MOTION for Leave to File Amicus Briefin Opposition to Plaintiffs' Emergency Motion for Injunction Pending Appeal by AMERICA FIRST LEGAL FOUNDATION.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an unopposed motion for leave to file amicus brief in opposition to their emergency motion for injunction pending appeal on July 15, 2025, by America First Legal Foundation.
